Calculus is easy and he makes it so much more difficult than it needs to be. Skip class, show up for quizzes, and do the homework (not graded) and youll do fine.

Name: Eric Choi
Comment: He is okay, but his lectures can go a little too fast. Just use  the textbook to study and you should be okay.

Name: Eric Choi
Comment: I think Dr. Choi is one of the best professors in the math department. He cares about students and he's always willing to help. However, he does talk a little bit fast and the last two questions on the tests are usually tough. The quizzes are not hard - they are directly taken out from the textbook.

Name: Eric Choi
Comment: Dr. Choi is one of the Best professors in the Math department. He knows his students by their names and really cares about teaching. He's kinda "lazy", so he never collects homework. Easy quizzes and quizzes are directly chosen from homework. If you go to every class and try to pay attention, an A is guaranteed.

Name: Eric Choi
Comment: He seems very nice, but he talks super fast and often gets involved in a personal conversation with a student in front of the entire class. I'm not here to watch you kindle a friendship. I'm here to earn multivariable calculus.

Name: Eric Choi
Comment: Eric is one of my favorite professors! He cares deeply about his students and does his best to help everyone succeed. You have to keep up with the material but his tests are not rather straightforward and not too challenging. I would definitely recommend him for multivariable!

Name: Eric Choi
Comment: He is personable, helpful, and genuinely wants his students to do well. He provides clear lecture notes, encourages questions, and is often available for office hours.  You must put fourth some effort to succeed, but tests are fair and doable.

Name: Eric Choi
Comment: Professor Choi is amazing overall. He acknowledges that Multivariable is a difficult class and simply wants his students to get good grades. His exams are fair and he replaces your lowest exam grade if you do better on another exam. If lots of people have trouble with a topic, most likely, it won't be on the exam.. Work hard and ask questions!

Name: Boyi Yang
Comment: Worst teacher ever had in my life, simply reciting the book. Does not teach on the blackboard but only write on scratch paper and use the projector to show the class. Only teaches solving one and another endless questions, and does not want to explain why when students asked him during office hours. If you meet him, flee.

Name: Boyi Yang
Comment: Throughout the semester he was trying to convince us that the calculus is just standard procedures and everyone should be able to do it.  He explained the examples from the book in great detail. He did teach straight from the textbook, but I feel it is helpful.  Overall not a very hard class.

Name: Boyi Yang
Comment: I did well in this class. But honestly, this is one of my worst course at Emory. A few things: His teaching style is reading off the text book, not much explanation, which made the lecture very dry. Second, he changes the schedule all the time, meaning you will be informed that the midterm has been rescheduled only a week from the new test day.

Name: Boyi Yang
Comment: I've had a positive experience with Dr. Yang. His lectures are straight from the book and nothing he asks you to do on the quizzestests are too difficult. On top of that, he grades the tests on a curve so your real score is a lot higher than your raw score. I'd recommend him if you don't mind putting in some work on your own time outside of class.

Name: Boyi Yang
Comment: His teaching is vague and only briefly touches on the first couple examples in the book. The quizzes and tests are not as straightforward as the homework problems and examples done in class and he is not that helpful so you have to learn the material on your own.

Name: Boyi Yang
Comment: Professor Yang is absolutely sharp and funny, this class made my semester!!

Name: Boyi Yang
Comment: He is one of the best professors in Emory! He is very kind, and he always set up a lot of office hours to help students solve problems. The tests are not really hard as long as you reviewed carefully. There is always a proof question in the test, which is very easy as long as you can recite it. In one word, he is very very good!!

Name: Boyi Yang
Comment: I took Boyi's Math 111 in Fall 2012. He is an amazing instructor and a really cool guy. He made calculus straightforward to us with lots of examples. He also told jokes in class and they were hilarious! I highly recommend professor Yang. His early morning calculus class has been one of the highlights for my freshman year at Emory

Name: Boyi Yang
Comment: The study guides he gave online are extremely important. The quizzes and tests are pretty much the same questions from the study guides with different numbers. He uses the textbook heavily and taught us a lot more than just high school calculus. His lectures are straightforward but could get boring sometimes. Take him over other teachers!

Name: Boyi Yang
Comment: This professor is very interesting. He sometimes make hilarious jokes in the middle of the lectures which he call"mental breaks". Professor Boyi tries to teach us more than just high school calculus. You can learn a lot from him if you work hard. Grades are not a problem. I think half of the class got A's.

Name: Paul Bruno
Comment: Quizzes are easy, straight from the odd textbook problems, also most on the midterms and finals borrow from the textbook but much harder. He lectures quickly and gets distracted easily. Partial credit for most things, lenient grader. I went to calc help sessions with the grad students which were more helpful than his office hours.

Name: Paul Bruno
Comment: Honestly if you just do the practice problems in the book you'll be fine.

Name: Paul Bruno
Comment: He is a really easy grader and will easily give you points back if you talk to him about your test. the first two tests were easy and then they got hard and the final was ridic. not that good at explaining things so you will have to teach yourself but he is really relaxed and an easy grader

Name: Paul Bruno
Tag: ['Accessible outside class', 'Lots of homework', 'Gives good feedback']
Comment: I don't agree with the idea that we need an AP background, but I do think we should spend much time previewing and reviewing the textbook. His quizzes are easy and the three midterms are ok. Final is harder but he curves if everyone does worse. He's a nice guy and this class is not that hard but it really takes time and effort to get used to.

Name: Paul Bruno
Comment: Professor Bruno isn't for everyone, but for I personally enjoyed his class. He lectures rather quickly, but provides many office hours to answer questions. He gives a lot of partial credit and is very clear what he expects on quizzes and tests. Quizzes are very easy as they are straight from homework, and he curves the test if the class does badly.

Name: Paul Bruno
Tag: ['Test heavy', 'Accessible outside class', "Skip class? You won't pass."]
Comment: The exam questions require application skills and not simply memorizing steps to solve a problem. Would recommend having an AP Calculus background before taking him because lectures are fast. Your success in the class depends on whether you are taking the time to do the HW weekly and visiting him during office hours to make sure you understand.

Name: Paul Bruno
Tag: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy', 'Lecture heavy']
Comment: Extremely difficult class. Quizzes are easy, but exams are on another level. Final is even worse than the midterms.

Name: Paul Bruno
Comment: Not friendly, not easy, not a good time. 10/10 would not recommend.

Name: Paul Bruno
Comment: A really nice professor who grades leniently and offers a lot of partial credits. The quizzes and tests are very similar to homework problems. He wants us to really learn knowledge so there won't be tricky questions on the test. As long as you do all the homework and prepare for the exams, you will be fine.

Name: Paul Bruno
Comment: A really nice professor. Talks a little fast but really cares about students and is accessible during office hours. By far the exam and quizzes are reasonable. I would definitely recommend him.

Name: Bradley Elliott
Comment: Great teacher. Super accessible outside of class and very open to helping students learn. Probably the best math teacher (lecture-wise) that Ive ever had. Grading was pretty fair but the exams were usually much much more difficult than example given in class and even the ones on the study guide to a certain extent. Good choice for calc tho.

Name: Bradley Elliott
Comment: Solid choice for Calc II. Sometimes unclear on grade criteria on exams.

Name: Bradley Elliott
Tag: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Accessible outside class']
Comment: Extremely clear, organized lectures. Gives plenty of homework problems (not mandatory) to help practice for weekly quizzes. Tests sometimes push you to apply other concepts, but are graded fairly. Always accessible in office hours and will gladly work extra problems to help you understand. Also brings in occasional treats (: Take him if you can!

Name: Bradley Elliott
Comment: Very good teacher in person and a great lecturer

Name: Bradley Elliott
Comment: Brad was really good. The course was more about math than cs, but Brad gave interesting programming assignments for us to apply what we learned. My only complaint is that we had to use Python and couldn't use Java instad.

Name: Bradley Elliott
Comment: Brad was a really good teacher.  I could tell he put a lot of work into his lessons and was always willing to repeat concepts,  give more examples, or meet with me in office hours.

Name: Bradley Elliott
Comment: Graduate student in the math department. Teaches lower level math classes, as expected. He's not a professor to be avoided, but he's not one to be specifically sought out.

Name: Jeffrey Davis
Comment: Weekly quizzes over lectures. More challenging if you haven't had calc before. 3 tests. Drops lowest 2 quizzes. One of the easier calc teachers here

Name: Jeffrey Davis
Comment: Pretty clear in explaining topics in class and if you dont understand them then hell take the time to help you understand them. Very responsive to emails. Quizzes once a week but are nothing to really sweat about. Exams are very fair and he wont try to trick you. Make sure you know how to do the end of chapter problems and you will be fine.

Name: Jeffrey Davis
Comment: Professor Davis is everything you want in a Calc 1 professor. He's a good lecturer, doesn't try to trick you on tests, is happy to meet with you outside class, and grades quizzes/tests very fast. Quizzes and even some exam problems are taken directly from the homework, so if you do the homework, you won't have a problem in the class.

Name: Jeffrey Davis
Comment: You can tell Jeffrey really cares for his students and wants them to succeed. Weekly quizzes are common but they are similar to the homework from the text. He's a big Gamecock fan so he often includes a chance to win candy if you guess the scores of the weekly game correctly. Great teacher, relatable, and professional!

Name: Jeffrey Davis
Comment: Very good professor! Test comes from homework, fair grading and gives candy. Recommend to everyone!

Name: Jeffrey Davis
Comment: I had an absolutely great experience in calc 111 with Jeffrey Davis. He is a grad student, but his teaching style is very professional and clear. The level of the class, book, and exams all correlate very well together. He truly wants students to learn and makes himself available to helping in any way he can. I would recommend to everyone!

Name: Jeffrey Davis
Comment: Throughout my educational career, I have never had a good math professor. Mr. Davis changed that. He explained concepts in a very easy to learn manner. He gives quizzes most Fridays, but most come straight out of the homework problems. His tests are meant to see if you understand the concepts and are rarely meant to trick you.

Name: Sean Thomas
Comment: He is a very fair professor. If you understand the HW problems, you should be more than fine for the exam. The questions are EXTREMELY similar. He is very explicit about what exactly you need to know for the exams.

Name: Sean Thomas
Comment: If you do the homework and pay attention during class, you won't have a problem for the test. Test questions are very similar to homework problems. Overall, a very good and fair professor!

Name: Sean Thomas
Comment: I am not very good at math but his class made it pretty straight forward.  If you are good at math you will think this class is the easiest thing ever!

Name: Sean Thomas
Comment: so easy, quizzes only help your grade and you can drop the lowest two.  quizzes are exactly same questions from the lecture with different numbers and some of exam questions are like that too.Take him for easy A calc 111 over other teachers.

Name: Sean Thomas
Comment: so easy, all the quizzes only help your grade and the questions are almost same with different number.  even some of exam questions are like that.  definitely take him for an easy A

Name: Sean Thomas
Comment: not helpful, and should review his undergrad

Name: Kinnari Amin
Comment: Statistics is a complex course already, so adding a tough professor does not help.Statistics + Amin = not an A

Name: Kinnari Amin
Comment: pros:works with you, nice, and organized. cons: exams are hard, and you can't correct her, even when she is wrong.

Name: Kinnari Amin
Comment: She gives entirely too many details to the point of making the subject more confusing and difficult than needed. She does not have reviews before tests. Her tests are very detailed, very long and very difficult, even when you have studied.

Name: Kinnari Amin
Comment: I thought Amin was a reasonably teacher. Her tests aren't that bad, but you have to really study and put in the time to do all your homework because some hw/assignment problems appear on the tests. However, the subject matter was not terribly difficult for me because I took AP Stat in high school....

Name: Kinnari Amin
Comment: She made this class so much harder than it should have been, she is a terrible teacher and her tests were ridiculously unfair.

Name: Kinnari Amin
Comment: Her statistics tests were unfair and way too hard when compared to other stat sections

Name: Luke Postle
Comment: He drips with sarcasm, but is a good lecturer. Exams are very basic and guides you through hard problems. Very helpful, dedicates time IN CLASS before exams to notify you with what will be on the exam. Always does in class reviews and schedules them to fit everyone's schedule. Lab is not mandatory. TAKE HIM!

Name: Luke Postle
Comment: He is smart and really cares about students. Final is a bit harder than midterms but still an east A.

Name: Luke Postle
Comment: Very smart and willing to help. Doesn't respond to emails. He does examples from the book in lecture but I'd rather he just make sure we understand it conceptually. I'd say pretty average. He's a grad student and needs some help with lecturing skills but good nontheless.

Name: Luke Postle
Comment: Lectures are hard to follow. He assumes everyone is on the same page as him. The homework problems he assigns to turn in are really difficult! His exams are just as hard. It's tough to say anything positive about his class and teaching.

Name: Luke Postle
Comment: Good Professor, easy A

Name: Luke Postle
Comment: Terrible. If you've never taken calc you won't get through. I took calc in HS and he made me confused about concepts I already knew! Everything you need is in the book: I did better on tests when I skipped class and just read the book/did practice problems. Predictable tests until the final which brought me down a full letter grade.

Name: Mark Norfleet
Tag: ['Accessible outside class', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Lots of homework']
Comment: Dr. Norfleet's class is easy but you have to do a lot of work to do well. The quizzes are straight out of the homework and he assigns A LOT of homework. You have to go to class because he teaches you specifically how to do problems that will be on tests that the textbook does not do and he is confusing at times.

Name: Mark Norfleet
Comment: His tests are pretty clear and straightforward, and not that hard. He grades kind of hard, but it's not overly ridiculous.  His lectures are hit or miss. Overall he is pretty straightforward

Name: Mark Norfleet
Comment: Mark is a very fair professor and interesting lecturer. If you are not a math person, any math class would be equally as difficult. Calculus 2 is not a easy  subject, so if math is hard for you, you need to put in effort to do well. He does offer extra review sessions and plenty of office hour times before exams. And he gives tons of extra credit.

Name: Mark Norfleet
Comment: I took Mark for Math 112. He does over complicate simple things but otherwise his lectures are clear and, for the most part, to the point. The grade consists of 2 mid-terms, quizzes and a final however he lets you choose how much you want each aspect to weigh. Quizzes are easy and are from the homework but midterms are definitely more difficult.

Name: Mark Norfleet
Comment: Isn't the best at teaching as he overcomplicates simple things, but that doesn't mean you can't get an A in the class. Most of my learning came from doing the hw, reading the book and going to office hours. I'm an A student and got an A. Your grade will depend on your effort as with every class.

Name: Mark Norfleet
Comment: Mark is extremely enthusiastic and offers a lot of extra credit! There are quizzes every week so it's ok if you mess up on a couple. Also, he gives you the option of how much weight u want on quiz/test/midterms. HW is pretty much optional. Class time is mainly for seeing him work out problems, but you don't have to attend if you are good at Calc!

Name: Brendan Montagnes
Comment: The grades are low, but the threshold for A is low too. More than half of the class can eventually get an A. Go to the lectures. Although not mandatory and not related to the exams, you can learn a lot. Study the notes and you can do well. Super accessible outside the class, and nice to chat randomly with. Good to know him.

Name: Brendan Montagnes
Comment: terrible

Name: Brendan Montagnes
Comment: I somewhat received an A in this class. However, I think the professor is not good enough for this class. Pablo always tests on materials that he does not emphasize and explain clearly. Also, heard he stole problem sets and exam questions from his peer instructor. He needs efforts to improve his teaching styles in the perspective of students.

Name: Brendan Montagnes
Comment: Heard that this professor was good but turned out to be a disaster. Material was really important but he just didnt explain them very well. Problem sets are confusing and there were no practice problems at all. The lectures were dry and boring. Grading was tough and the curving was not that appealing.

Name: Brendan Montagnes
Comment: The material is very important, in my opinion. However, he did not do a great job in teaching the thinking process clearly. He just read his slides, tell jokes and making fun of things he despise all semester. Hell, the slides weren't even that helpful either tbh. Grading criteria wasn't clear. 2 deadlines appeared for the same assignment.

Name: Brendan Montagnes
Comment: Amazing professor! His lectures and readings are very interesting, and you will do great as long as you go to class and put in effort. He is also very helpful during office hour. One of the best professor I have at Emory!

Name: Brendan Montagnes
Comment: This professor also goes by Pablo, just to be clear. He's a great professor and cares about his students. His lectures can be dull, but the content of the class is very interesting. GO TO CLASS. He will grade you more favorably if you do.

Name: Susan Janiszewski
Comment: Nice teacher, but tough class.

Name: Susan Janiszewski
Comment: Very demanding professor. Good if you are naturally good at calc, but don't take it expecting an easy A.

Name: Susan Janiszewski
Comment: Take her for calculus. Easiest professor ever!

Name: Susan Janiszewski
Comment: She is very clear and gives daily quizzes which helped me keep up with the work. Never asked unnecessarily hard questions or made things more complicated than they needed to be.

Name: Susan Janiszewski
Comment: She is really great. Really wants you to succeed. The class is not that hard if you keep up with the homework. She is more than willing to meet with you to help you.

Name: Xuan Chen
Comment: He is very hard to understand, not very accessible, and his PowerPoints lack information to study from outside of class. I got so frustrated that I started to show up only for tests.

Name: Xuan Chen
Comment: He's not the best at explaining stuff, but he really tries to make sure that everyone understands the materials. He can get a little awkward during lecture, but he has a nice sense of humor sometimes. You'll be fine if you pay attention in class and take good notes.

Name: Xuan Chen
Comment: Clear lecture and easy to understand. Test is similar to sample test. will recommend.

Name: Xuan Chen
Comment: Chen is the literal woat. NEVER take him. thats all. I have no words. you will fail the final even if you attend the class and read the notes because they do not teach you how to apply the concepts you're taught in class. I was gonna make a QTM joke, but I didn't learn enough to make one up.

Name: Xuan Chen
Comment: really, really hard to understand and lectures do not make sense. not good at explaining concepts at all, mumbles, and basically just reads off the powerpoint slides

Name: Paul Wrayno
Comment: I had him at CNU. He was the worst teacher I have ever had in my life. You have to teach yourself all of the material and he gives homework every class. He is s sweet person but a terrible teacher. GOODLUCK if you take him.

Name: Paul Wrayno
Comment: I had Professor Wrayno at CNU and he was very confusing. The class slides had little to do with the homework, and none of what we learned was the material we were tested on. I think Prof. Wrayno is very intelligent, but I don't feel I learned anything from his class. All that I did learn from MATH125 is information I taught myself on my own time.

Name: Paul Wrayno
Comment: Wrayno was literally one of the most awful teachers I have ever had. So boring and really rude on top of it all

Name: Paul Wrayno
Comment: Prof. Wrayno is not a very interesting teacher.  There was lots of sleeping and this class is aimed at people who already have a good calc backgroud.  If you don't you will probably struggle.  I wouldn't suggest Wrayno.

Name: Ryan Garibaldi
Comment: Dr. Garibaldi is probably the best professor i've had at Emory. He is extremely enthusiastic about linear algebra, and is a very engaging professor with a great sense of humor. Tests are based on the homework and are fairly easy. I would recommend taking any class taught by him.

Name: Ryan Garibaldi
Comment: Professor Garibaldi is a very enthusiastic teacher. He likes trying to get the class into the  lecture. Great teacher in my opinion and the best way to study for his tests are through the homework he assigns and the supplementary questions after each chapter. His tests are BASED OFF HIS HOMEWORK so don't get behind in it!

Name: Ryan Garibaldi
Comment: So enthusiastic about everything, and a great teacher!! Tests are hard, but very fair. Would love to take another class with him but pretty sure I've already taken all the classes he teaches...

Name: Ryan Garibaldi
Comment: This guy is what I would call a "surfer dude". Nonetheless, he is a great professor. Lectures are based entirely on the book. Homework is graded, which is good because tests ARE BASED ENTIRELY ON HOMEWORK! He also grades tests "like an essay" giving an "overall" grade of how he feels you did. The final was very difficult, and brought my A- to a B

Name: Samy Wu
Comment: Great Professor. If you have AP background, you do not have to study. Maybe 10 minutes before the exam to review things really quickly but if you took AP calc you are set. If you did  not take AP calc in high school, as long as you do the homework and show up to class, you are good. He picks his quiz questions from the homework.

Name: Samy Wu
Comment: An amazing professor. Kind of shy, but he's hilarious. Gives homework from which he chooses the questions for the quizzes. His tests are pretty easy and straightforward. Definitely recommend taking his class for calculus.

Name: Samy Wu
Comment: Samy is super cool, he is really understanding and sweet and genuinely wants you to do well. His tests are not hard, the quizzes are easy 100's if you do the homework, again not much. Midterms are at a good level and final was comparatively tough but nothing that he did not teach, everything was covered.

Name: Samy Wu
Comment: Samy is a cool guy and seems to care about your grade until he gives you a test. The tests are DEFINITELY harder in comparison to the easy homework and weekly quizzes that he gives. You can have Calculus knowledge prior to taking his class but once you take his tests, you'll see how it critically tests what calculus you know to it's FULL context

Name: Madeline Locus Dawsey
Comment: Professor Dawsey is amazing and I loved taking her class (even in the morning on a Monday). Attendance isn't mandatory, but so much information is covered in class, and she does a great job explaining all the concepts, so it's really beneficial to attend.

Name: Madeline Locus Dawsey
Comment: I absolutely loved taking Calculus 2 with Professor Madeline Locus-Dawsey. She was very knowledgeable about the subject and is also very relatable as she is currently a grad student as well. She always will make time for her students if they are in need, replies to emails quickly, and gives the best lectures I've had so far in my Emory career.

Name: Madeline Locus Dawsey
Comment: I loved Professor Locus Dawsey. She is very kind and would always sit down with me to explain concepts I did not understand. Knows the material well. Take her if you can!

Name: Madeline Locus Dawsey
Comment: She's incredibly nice. Grades based on knowing concepts rather than stupid mistakes. Exam and quiz questions are extensions of what we learned in class. Definitely recommend!

Name: Alex Viguerie
Comment: Great instructor. Willing to help you if you are struggling in Calculus, and appears to be very well-versed in the subject. Not exactly the most engaging or interactive instructor, but this should not be a major issue for most people.

Name: Alex Viguerie
Comment: I think he definitely knows what he's talking about, however, his lectures are not very interactive at all. It's just him talking to the board mostly (which is fine usually) but I am prefer more active learning, personally. Do the homework, the tests are pretty comprehensive and long--I felt the time given was not enough for the amount of content.

Name: Alex Viguerie
Comment: Good professor overall, clear lecturer, friendly, and always willing to meet outside of class. He's strict with grading though, I ended the semester with a 92.8 and he would not round that up from an A- to an A.

Name: Alex Viguerie
Comment: Very elaborate lecturer. Always asks for the opinion of students. Tests are fine if you put in the work. Quizzes every week but drops lowest 3. You can always ask him questions in office hours and after class. Makes the difficult concepts in Calculus understandable. Definitely take him if you're taking Calculus I.

Name: Maryam Khaqan
Comment: her tests are so hard. my average is a b-

Name: Maryam Khaqan
Comment: No comments, please don't take her class. Bad at teaching and tough grading.

Name: Maryam Khaqan
Tag: ['Accessible outside class', 'Graded by few things', 'Tough grader']
Comment: She is not a good teacher class average is a C. You do not want this class. Not bc of her teaching ability but toughness of questions on exams. Her questions are way way harder than all other teachers. DO NOT TAKE HER

Name: Maryam Khaqan
Comment: Dr. Khaqan cares very much about her students, but her teaching abilities are lacking. Her lectures, for the most part, were disorganized, and I found the book to be a better instructor than her. However, I believe I was in her first class ever, which could attest to her lack of confidence. She did get better as the semester progressed.

Name: Charles Stone
Comment: Difficult class, but very fair and very clear.  If you seek help, he will give it.

Name: Charles Stone
Comment: Yes, he's hard, but he's very, very fair and extremely helpful during his office hours.  Additionally he curved when it was necissary.

Name: Charles Stone
Comment: Incredibly dull and boring class. Teacher has 0 personality. No relatioship with students. Covers material very quickly and does many things "by the rules". No shortcuts allowed. Very difficult grading.

Name: Benjamin Shemmer
Comment: I had Mr. Shemmer for calculus 1. He made the class very interesting and he truly cared whether or not we were understanding the material. He would slow down when needed. The exams were fairly difficult, but he always generously curved them. I highly recommend this teacher!!

Name: Benjamin Shemmer
Comment: Very cool guy, entertaining stories...HARD TEACHER (evem people who have taken AB and BC in high school have ridiculous difficulty in his intro calc class). Builds test to lower grades, curves, but if one person breaks the curve you are in trouble. Grading is fair and partial credit is given, but often questions are from obscure parts of book.

Name: Benjamin Shemmer
Comment: really great, reminds me of my calculus teacher in high school, funny helpful and a good teacher!

Name: Hassan Palta
Comment: Very cool teacher, helpful and understanding. thumbs up!!

Name: Hassan Palta
Comment: Nice guy

Name: Hassan Palta
Comment: He's a good professor, knows his stuff!

Name: Victor Larsen
Comment: great teacher. great personality. great overall guy. one of the better math professors i've had.

Name: Victor Larsen
Comment: A quite helpful instructor. Super nice and interesting!

Name: Victor Larsen
Comment: Best at explaining. He relates it so you understand no matter how bad U R Hes always encouraging and patient.He genuinely cares about students success. Generous on petty mistakes if you demonstrate understanding.quiz every week to keep you caught up.Calc 2 is tough it takes studying to be proficient.Take him he's the best math Prof Ive ever had.

Name: Jessica Fuller
Comment: Professor Fuller is really sweet and is there for you if you need help. While it's a lot of content to go through in a semester, she is able to go through each problem/concept pretty clearly, although it can get confusing once you have to do the problems yourself. She's really funny and really seems to care about her students.

Name: Jessica Fuller
Comment: There are weekly quizzes and HW. Breakdown was as follows: Avg of 3 tests: 50% Final: 30% HWQuizzes: 20%  Overall she was a really great teacher even though there was a lot of work. She drops the two lowest quizzes which helps. She's really nice and always available for office hours so help is there if you need it. Don't bother with the textbook

Name: Jessica Fuller
Comment: Jessica Fuller will teach you calculus. While there is a lot of work for the class, if you do it you will get a good grade. Also if you meet with her she is very helpful. Would HIGHLY recommend for calc 111

Name: Reed Gordon-Sarney
Comment: Reed's a cool guy. Lectures are extremely clear, help is there if you ask, and the class really isn't that hard: tests are reasonably and Reed still curves them since they are "more difficult than necessary."

Name: Reed Gordon-Sarney
Comment: Great lecturer. Tough material but very lucid and straightforward explanations. Overall very good professor and I would recommend if you are serious about math and will put some effort in. Its hard but very possible to do well.

Name: Reed Gordon-Sarney
Comment: He has lots of notes for lecture. He is nice and always ready to answer your questions. For his quiz and midterm, you'd better write out every procedure. Final is super hard.

Name: Victor Manuel Aricheta
Comment: He's one of my favorite professors that I've had at Emory so far. He really knows what he's teaching and is beyond capable of explaining concepts. Also, he is very approachable and willing to work with you if you need help understanding something. He's hilarious and I really enjoyed going to his class each week. He's not hard to look at either! :)

Name: Victor Manuel Aricheta
Comment: I really enjoyed having him as a teacher because he is well versed at how to teach. By the time you finish the class, you will have learned Calculus in such a way that you will have retained it. I would recommend him to absolutely anyone, regardless of your beginning skill level!

Name: Victor Manuel Aricheta
Comment: Vicman, as he tells us to call him, is an amazing professor. He is clear and he does not leave anyone behind. If you have a question he will give you a well-explained answer. He also cracks many jokes and is hilarious.

Name: Silke Gehrke
Comment: I've had a great experience with her.  Her Math 107 class was really nice for a light load.

Name: Silke Gehrke
Comment: No Comments

Name: Qing Chu
Comment: I liked her class. She writes everything down on the board which makes it easy for us to takes notes. She gives feedback on every quiz and her tests are very do-able compared to other 111 professors. I definitely recommend her if you like a very structured and organized class - which is great for math. Gives extra credit opportunities sometimes.

Name: Qing Chu
Comment: Her English is not very good, so it's sometimes hard to undestand what she's saying, and most of my class has taken calc before, so some of the kids are disrespectful, but she tries hard for us.

Name: Eric Brussel
Comment: Extremely passionate about mathematics! Very helpful during the office hour and explains theories very well. Humorous! Highly recommend!!!

Name: Eric Brussel
Comment: Great professor! If you truly want to to learn something about maths, take his class. You can see that he is extremely helpful and knows a lot about what he is teaching. But if you are not confident about your IQ, dont take his class. His class is prepared for those who are most intelligent and enthusiastic in learning true maths.

Name: Hernando Bermudez
Comment: Good professor and knows a lot, but sometimes isn't clear with explaining problems. Sometimes skips important parts, but cares a lot about making sure that he is being clear. Not impatient; explains if you ask.

Name: Hernando Bermudez
Comment: If you are looking to simply finish the GERs then his is the right class. Students with genuine interest should take another instructor. He is a grad student and although he does know a great deal on the subject, it doesn't show in class. Doesn't incite interest.

Name: Amanda Clemm
Comment: She can be a bit unclear at times, but is willing to see you outside of class to give you any help you may need. Also, just do the homework, and the test questions are pretty much just reformulated homework problems. Class isn't necessary if you learn math by the textbook. She's also hot, and will sometimes go on a tangent for a fun story.

Name: Amanda Clemm
Comment: Super hot, pretty funny. Sometimes she gets confused or just has off days where she doesn't teach us much but she'll also recognize that and go back and review. If you miss a class or don't do the work you won't do well, otherwise it should be an easy A. She doesn't assign much mandatory homework. This class has really made me enjoy calc.

Name: Leandro Gryngarten
Comment: Tough but good

Name: Leandro Gryngarten
Comment: His grading criteria is as follows: 10% Quiz, 30% for each midterm (2)  final exam.  Very tough grader, most useless professor I've had in life. He gives unorganized and unclear lectures. AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS.

Name: Margaret Callahan
Comment: Very sweet & approachable, passionate about what she does. Class is taught directly from the textbook, however I don't know what the alternative would be because it is linear algebra. Heavy on proofs and t/f questions are horrible. Good professor, just boring material.

Name: Margaret Callahan
Comment: You can tell she really cares about her students and wants us all to learn to love linear algebra and math it as much as she does. Sometimes lectures are kinda slow since the material is easy, but then she'll say something adorable about how cool math is.   If you show up and pay attention you'll probably pass.

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: Best math professor I have had. Very clear and concise in his explanations. Very helpful, down to earth guy. Gave me skiing tips.

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: Passion: 28% F

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: he does card tricks in class.

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: No Comments

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: With his  incorrect logic and judgments as the guide, students can only be swallowed into the infinite swirl of confusion!

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: bray rocks!

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: Clark Bray is an extraordinary instructor.  He is competent, enthusiastic, and he emphasizes theory and conceptual understanding of material.

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: Dr. Bray is a great teacher.  Good lecturer, very concerned about students' learning, too.

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: Imagine having to teach a lecture on something.  You decide to teach it backwards and make it as complicated as possible, and then finally at the end of 50 minutes you say something that makes sense.  You are Clark Bray.

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: great prof.  best math teacher i've had...fun guy to talk to.  kinda has a johnny bravo thing going on. but a cool guy.  highly reccomended.

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: Dry lectures but they are detailed. Cute prof!

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: Stresses theory, very hard..but the course is worth it

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: The clearest and most inspiring instructor I ever had.

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: A nice guy. Decent lecturing ability. His tests are HARD!!!

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: No Comments

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: studly

Name: Clark Bray
Comment: No Comments

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: WOW.. TOUGH CLASS BUT FANTASTIC LECTURES THAT MAKE THE ASSIGNMENTS EASY TO FOLLOW

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: Great Professor but tough.

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: Dr. Batteh is one my favorite Professors.  I recommend him to anyone! His exams are a "B"

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: TOUGH AS HELL

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: Dr. Batteh's class fills up so fast. I was on a waiting list to get in.  He has a way of making complex Mathematical concepts easy to unravel

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: You know what they say? it is always easier the second time around.  I failed Doc's class and had to repeat it!

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: Doc is known for being an energetic and fun instructor.  However, they forgot to mention that his exams are hard as hell

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: Dr. Batteh was very helpful.  His exams are rigorous to say the least.  I am just thankful I got through the course

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: One of the BEST PROFESSORS here at Stanford!

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: Dr. Batteh's class was my best class.

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: Dr. Batteh was an amazing Professor.  He made the subject matter easy to understand.  His exams are a rough but fair.

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: Dr. Batteh's exams are rough.  I enjoyed his class.  I recommend taking is class.

Name: Jerry Batteh Batteh
Comment: TOUGH TOUGH TOUGH

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Tag: ['Tough grader', 'Lots of homework', 'Graded by few things']
Comment: Assigned reading and homework on Subject X, THEN a lecture on Subject X. Not effective at all.

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: Gives off a cool, relaxed sort of Paul Rudd-ish vibe.

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: Best Math teacher I have ever had, and one of the best professors I have had at Stanford. He explains things in a way that makes it easy to understand.

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: Mark is hilarious. He has some hilarious comments during lectures. I attend mostly for his jokes. Very clear and great teacher overall.

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: Funny, interesting, generally awesome!  He was really good at explaining stuff, even integrals.  52 didn't seem quite as hard as I thought it was going to.  Take him if you can!

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: Amazing prof, can explain complex topics like they're obvious and logical, the textbook just confused me but he was incredible. Great guy.

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: super easy, super hot and super helpful. I love Marc. He's so easy going and clear. If you are not techie enough to start with 51 right away, you want to take math 40 series with him for sure.

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: Confusing and goes off topic too much

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: Awesome, funny. Made a lot of jokes, which made the class fun.

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: No Comments

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: No Comments

Name: Marc Lucianovic
Comment: I've already had some calculus classes in the past, and if you have past experience, then these courses will be very easy. He goes through everything in lecture; if you don't understand, go to lecture! But if you do, then it's just coasting.

Name: Jay Bartroff
Comment: Jay is a HOT jazz musician. He was even cooler back at Caltech. I know it because I was one of his buddies at Caltech. Jay, keep in touch.

Name: Jay Bartroff
Comment: Jay is a HOT prof! go U of Waterloo!

Name: Jay Bartroff
Comment: Passion: 28% F

Name: Jay Bartroff
Comment: He's really great. You can relate to him and he effectively gets the information across to his students, staying until everything is clear

Name: Jay Bartroff
Comment: Hot and helpful.

Name: Jay Bartroff
Comment: Yea...he's really hot.  It's the only reason I went to class 5 days a week. That aside, he has a really great way of logically teaching statistics.  He represents the lessons step by step in multiple ways for people who learn differently - he uses varying kinds of graphs, pictures and verbal discriptions, etc. to reach out to everyone. Funny, too.

Name: Jay Bartroff
Comment: He's amazingly friendly and intelligent for a super hot guy.

Name: Jay Bartroff
Comment: No Comments

Name: Jay Bartroff
Comment: No Comments

Name: Jay Bartroff
Comment: Super sweet, helpful, and trys to make jokes to keep the class interesting. Oh, and did I mention he's hot?

Name: Ben Brubaker
Comment: Ben is a wonderful prof.  He is by far the best lecturer I have this semester.  Math is not my forte, but I really love Brubaker's class.

Name: Ben Brubaker
Comment: Ben Brubaker is one of the top math professors I have ever had; he is extremely helpful, friendly, funny, and makes class  extraordinarily enjoyable.  Glad to see he is now at MIT although I hope he finds his way back to Stanford.

Name: Ben Brubaker
Comment: Quite good.

Name: Ben Brubaker
Comment: Brubaker is my favorite prof. thus far, very good lectures and understandable even though the material was difficult.

Name: Ben Brubaker
Comment: Ben is wonderful. He takes great effort to know everyone in the class, and gives clear and fun lectures. He's obviously very knowledgable, and his love for math is infectious (really). He's also very helpful outside of class.

Name: Ben Brubaker
Comment: Ben is an awesome prof.  His lectures are entertaining, he really tries to make the material as fun as possible.  His office hours are also very helpful.

Name: Ben Brubaker
Comment: Haha, gotta agree with the first commentor - Ben is a math genius who's nice and really helpful. He's funny too. Really clear lectures, writes everything on the chalkboard. You'll write your first essay for math in Ben's class! Awesome guy, awesome class.

Name: Ben Brubaker
Comment: Ben is an AMAZING prof; take any class with him!! He's clear, concise, funny, [cute] and down-to-earth. He's also willing to put in as much time out of class as necessary to help you learn, should you need it. Coolest, smartest, best guy ever.

Name: Mark Meckes
Comment: The only examples he does in class are directly from the book, and ridiculously easy.  Therefore when you do the hard problems on the problem set or on the test, you are completely underprepared.  The TA's are generally bad, though a few are good.  Meckes is pretty helpful if you come in for office hours, though.

Name: Mark Meckes
Comment: You don't have to go to lecture if you read the book.  That's all he does. Take the text and write on the chalk board, and explain in verbatim from the textbook. You just take more notes.  (He also likes to write periods after everything.)  The TAs do suck.  All of them have thick accents.

Name: Mark Meckes
Comment: Mark Meckes is not only an excelent professor, but also funny and hot as hell. All of us girls think he is sexy with his sneaky tricks.

Name: Mark Meckes
Comment: An awesome teacher.  Explains essentials in class, but that is why you buy the book.  More than willing to help during is office hours and is very approachable.  His TAs do suck, especially Manuel

Name: Mark Meckes
Comment: Meckes was the best teacher I had all year.  He made math super easy and his exams were impossibly easy.  The practice exams he gave right before exams were exact replicas of the real exams, only the numbers were changed.  It was impossible to get anything but an A in his class.  And he was super nice and helpful!

Name: Mark Meckes
Comment: I agree with everything said in the other rating... Meckes expects you to learn everything yourself, and he is not open to the fact that maybe he does a poor job teaching the class... we hardly saw any examples in lecture... also, his TA's were terrible, especially the one I had (Ian)

Name: Mark Meckes
Comment: Meckes seems nice, but really he's the DEVIL.  He only explains the basics in class and expects you to figure everything else out yourself.  Exams are completely different from homework and practice exams.  His curve is awful-- the average grade is a C.  He blames all problems on students, not him.

Name: Razvan Fetecau
Tag: ['Gives good feedback', 'Lots of homework', "Skip class? You won't pass."]
Comment: Nice guy , uses AT THE END OF THE DAY alot ; you can have fun too

Name: Razvan Fetecau
Tag: ['Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback']
Comment: Nice guy but everything is somehow somewhat basic and trivial

Name: Razvan Fetecau
Comment: Heavy accent, yet writing is very clear, notes are extremely useful.

Name: Razvan Fetecau
Comment: He is gorgeous. Don't believe me, check out his personal website (linked to the math department's). His lectures were utterly incomprehensable during class, but if I wrote down everything he said, they were very helpful when I read them over (after reading the book). His accent was also very difficult to understand.

Name: Razvan Fetecau
Comment: Hard class. All the Math 50 series profs are hard but Math 52 is especially hard. They seem to be geniuses who don't understand that we're newbies trying to learn what they've already understood a million times over.

Name: Razvan Fetecau
Comment: His lectures are difficult; they are all long proofs and he starts 5 minutes before class! He is however, clear if you read ahead of time. He can be (very) condescending but is helpful in office hours. Despite his harsh standards, Fetecau is personable and kind - not to mention brilliant.

Name: Brian White
Comment: Crystal clear teacher. Never saw a teacher with such clear teaching in class.

Name: Brian White
Comment: Prof. White is the BEST.  Incredibly smart and can lecture without using any notes.  His speaking style is such that you're always engaged.  I took his class as an EE major and almost switched to math.  He's really friendly in office hours and very personable too if you ever invite him to faculty night.  Prof. White is a real treasure.

Name: Brian White
Comment: Professor White does a good job of clearly explaining mathematical concepts from a technical perspective, taking care to prove each of his theorems as he teaches. Easily one of the most popular professors of introductory math classes. Plus, he wears crazy Hawaiian shirts.

Name: Brian White
Comment: absolutely amazing. Everyone in every other lecture for math 51 this term ended up in professor white's lecture because he is simply that good.

Name: Brian White
Comment: Best teacher I've had in the math department--no surprise he's the only lecturer you're allowed to have if you're in ACE (accelerated calculus for engineers.) Clear, fair, and makes it interesting

Name: Steven Levandosky
Comment: great teacher

Name: Steven Levandosky
Comment: Very nics professor, though he could help out more with homework questions....

Name: Steven Levandosky
Comment: Very dry lectures but solid. Knows what he's talking about.

Name: Steven Levandosky
Comment: Levandosky is a solid lecturer.  Definitely one of the few in the math department here.

Name: Wojciech Wieczorek
Comment: Great teacher! highly recommend

Name: Wojciech Wieczorek
Comment: A bit difficult to understand, but definitely worth it. Very theoretical, but interesting guy.

Name: Wojciech Wieczorek
Comment: No Comments

Name: Wojciech Wieczorek
Comment: W. does a good job explaining everything he teaches.  He has a slight (polish) accent, but it doesn't detract from his ability to elucidate concepts.  He likes to assign really long and complicated problem sets.

Name: David Siegmund
Comment: The course is hard, and his exams are harder. But it's still great to take it with him because he's such a master at this, and is available if you need any help. I learned a lot with this course.

Name: David Siegmund
Comment: I took him years ago. He was very kind and helpful and always tried to answer everyone's questions. His lectures tended to emphasize details; you had to construct the big picture on your own. Could have been more clear, but a good prof and a good guy.

Name: David Siegmund
Comment: He tells students that homework scores are not taken into account for the final grade, but...... His surly attitude takes away joy from the learning process.

Name: David Siegmund
Comment: Prof. Siegmund is very patient, teaches at a decent pace, and is very willing to be interrupted and asked questions.  Stats116 is still hard, but Prof. Siegmund may be a good professor to take it with.

Name: Doron Levy
Comment: Awesome teacher, definitely the students' favorite out of all the 51 lecturers. Very energetic, helpful, and is a great explainer.

Name: Doron Levy
Comment: This guy is good for people with a strong mathematics base, but if you're coming into a class like 51 as a normal kid trying to fulfill a requirement, he sucks. He doesn't explain concepts in depth (to the point where you get that 'OH!' and understand) or explain the why or how behind concepts.

Name: Doron Levy
Comment: No Comments

Name: Doron Levy
Comment: Great teacher who explains concepts clearly and effectively.

Name: Gregory Brumfiel
Comment: Good teacher, even though initially he honestly expected at least half of us to fail/drop his course (and would remind us how hard his class was). That said, he was a great lecturer and I learned a ton from his class.

Name: Gregory Brumfiel
Comment: He assigned problem sets from the book but tested exclusively on completely different material, namely, his handouts on field theory. Not a good job at all.

Name: Gregory Brumfiel
Comment: Professor Brumfiel is, for lack of a better word, blustering.  His lectures for Math110 were mediocre, but for a grad level class I bet he'd be a lot better.  He's really great during office hours, though.

Name: Gregory Brumfiel
Comment: No Comments

Name: Adrian Butscher
Comment: his tests are really hard but if you get butschered and survived his class, you're pretty much sure that you can pass the harder courses ahead of you. not really a bad professor but if you dont have the will to stay in the course and work harder, you'll die.

Name: Adrian Butscher
Comment: I *really* learned math with him. His tests are pretty  hard, but if you do all the book questions you should be fine. Very nice guy outside of class.

Name: Adrian Butscher
Comment: I thought his class was hard but really good.  His lectures are more theory than practice examples. If you do his problem sets carefully, the tests are not too bad, though they are still hard. He is a really cool guy to talk to, too.

Name: Adrian Butscher
Comment: No Comments

Name: Rob Tibshirani
Comment: He doesn't seem very interested in teaching the class. Good research is what gets you recognition at Stanford. He recognizes this and that's why he doesn't spend as much time with the course as he should. Only the students would benefit from doing this, not him unfortunately........

Name: Rob Tibshirani
Comment: didn't really like the class

Name: Rob Tibshirani
Comment: can't teach

Name: Rob Tibshirani
Comment: Tibs is the worst teacher I have ever had. I think his preparation is lacking as evidenced by the fact students notice mistakes in his slides midway through the lecture. Friends with some of the students outside of class. Not right because the questions on midterm are quite subjective. Profs shouldn't be friends with students who aren't advisees!!!

Name: Yitzhak Katznelson
Comment: His textbook (which he wrote himself) is brilliantly clear. His lectures are incomprehensible. I never understood why there was such a difference.

Name: Yitzhak Katznelson
Comment: Ditto what the other person said.  Clearly he's a world famous researcher.  His teaching though is incomprehensible.  Didn't learn a thing from 113, took 114 with Milgram, and everything suddenly made sense.

Name: Yitzhak Katznelson
Comment: This was one of the hardest classes I've taken.  His lectures are worthless cause you can't understand anything he says.  Supposedly he is a genius- but in the research field.  I don't doubt that.  As an educator, he stinks.

Name: Daniel Willis Bump
Comment: My experience with this professor was awful. He was very unhelpful and I ended up learning everything on my own without his help. I should have just stared at the wall rather than wasted my time in this class. He did not BUMP my grade up!

Name: Daniel Willis Bump
Comment: Yikes! Had to learn everything on my own.

Name: Daniel Willis Bump
Comment: super SMART

Name: Amir Dembo
Comment: It's a really theoretical and challenging course, especially for those who do not have a strong pure math background. The professor always tries to help and is obliging and available for outside class discussions and Q&A.

Name: Amir Dembo
Comment: No Comments

Name: Amir Dembo
Comment: Wonderful guy, wonderful course. Go Dembo!

Name: Gautam Iyer
Comment: No Comments

Name: Gautam Iyer
Comment: gautam is the man...plus he writes random linux utilities that make things transparent

Name: Gautam Iyer
Comment: Lecture goes fast . . . he really knows what he is talking about.  Very hard class, but he is really good at office hours.

Name: Tai-Ping Liu
Comment: The most negligent professor I have ever had.  Does not care about teaching.  Does not care about students.  Just read the ee263 course reader and skip this class.

Name: Tai-Ping Liu
Comment: Incomprehensible during lecture, although definitely entertaining in a ridiculous way. He grades the exams himself-- with anal retention.

Name: Tai-Ping Liu
Comment: Doesn't show up for office hours; not responsive to student needs; unlcear homework and exam questions.  Seems uninterested in teaching anymore.  I recommend against his course.

Name: Nancy Zhang
Comment: She was strict and had high expectations.

Name: Nancy Zhang
Comment: No Comments

Name: Nancy Zhang
Comment: Nancy Zhang is really nice, and she's quite an amusing character, but she's a horrible professor... take it with someone else if you can.

Name: Vladislav Kargin
Comment: I really recommend this class. Its so great! Professor Kargin is an amazing teacher and has so much to share! Best class at Stanford

Name: Vladislav Kargin
Comment: This is a great professor. Although he is hard to understand, he really cares about his students and does everything to help them. Take this class its really awesome!!!

Name: Vladislav Kargin
Comment: Professor Kargin is almost impossible to understand. The class is terrible. I haven't learned a thing from lecture, just from the book and section.

Name: Maryam Mirzakhani
Comment: She is the Number one Teacher in The World

Name: Maryam Mirzakhani
Comment: We will miss you Professor Mirzakhani. You were the most genius lady in the world. You are Proud of the World and all Iranian.

Name: Maryam Mirzakhani
Comment: She  is very smart, with a little Iranian accent. I love her passion and few people in the world are genius as her. Proud to be a student of a staller.

Name: Anthony D'Aristotile
Comment: No Comments

Name: Anthony D'Aristotile
Comment: Tony is a really nice guy, but his lectures are just so dry and they don't contribute much towards understanding difficult problems.

Name: Adrian Clingher
Comment: Cool guy, but not very lively; difficult accent; not very helpful looking at the material from different angles.

Name: Adrian Clingher
Comment: Great guy!

Name: Hamlin Allen
Comment: No Comments

Name: Ravi Vakil
Comment: very inspiring professor! You can feel in every class that he loves his field and enjoys sharing his passion for mathematics with his students.

Name: Ravi Vakil
Comment: No Comments

Name: Persi Diaconis
Comment: Great!

Name: Persi Diaconis
Comment: Diaconis is possibly the worst kind of teacher there is--gives difficult material but fails to explain it.  He writes everything on the board and his handwriting is abominable.  He lectures too fast and never bothers to check if anyone understands.  He is a very smart guy and does some fascinating work, but he's an awful lecturer.

Name: Ben Lee
Comment: I don't know. I really liked him. I think he really did care about helping students to understand the material. If you told him you needed help he was very accommodating. I was grateful to him. I wish I could have him for math51 as well. He made sure everyone in the class understood before moving on.

Name: Ben Lee
Comment: Awful, rude and completely condescending.  Opt for Math 42 if 19 is only offered by Lee.  Truly appalling how little he cared about students.

Name: Andras Vasy
Comment: Prof. Vasy's lectures are great, but hard.

Name: Andras Vasy
Comment: Andras is teaching m113 with a new book, so it's much easier now (2006-07) than last year (2005-06).  He pretty much covers the book proof by proof in lecture - miss a class and you can just review the book to see what you missed.  Both the lectures and the book are fairly easy to understand.

Name: Todor Milanov
Comment: hes nice

Name: Todor Milanov
Comment: An interesting professor.  Sick Russian accent.  Incredibly neat - almost to the point of obsessive compulsive.  Teaches quickly, even when students' eyes have glazed over.  But that may be every Math 51 professor.

Name: Leo Tzou
Comment: Drawing from previous comments. He can be quite an interesting character but rather obnoxious at the same time. He taught the class, rather well, but perhaps disregarded the pace of the class. It depends on your preferences.

Name: Leo Tzou
Comment: Leo Tzou is one of those love or hate professors. If you don't mind having a little fun in class, you'll probably like him. If you like the more interesting parts of multivariable integration--that is, you'd rather think about the geometry of space rather than arbitrarily hard integrations--then you'll probably like him too. A very memorable class.

Name: Eric Bahuaud
Comment: He's very approachable, a really nice guy!

Name: Johnathan Taylor
Comment: He was very hard to follow and made many mistakes. I wouldn't recommend taking Stats with him.

Name: Johnathan Taylor
Comment: Taylor Rule is awesome.  Great Prof.

Name: Ralph Selig
Comment: Great Professor all around

Name: Ralph Selig
Comment: He is a very caring professor. Always available to help.

Name: Ralph Selig
Comment: Great Expositur

Name: Ralph Selig
Comment: Dr S. is very patient and good.Explains everything until you understand it.Highly recommend him.

Name: Ralph Selig
Comment: He is an excellent lecturer.Patient and passionate about his subject

Name: Ralph Selig
Comment: Dr. Selig really rocks my world. He lectures well.

Name: Ralph Selig
Comment: He is very good

Name: Ralph Selig
Comment: Very organized,and explains very clearly definitly recommend

Name: Ralph Selig
Comment: Three cheers

Name: Michael Frame
Comment: Dr. Frame is, truthfully, the best professor i've ever had at Yale. In fact, he might be the best instructor i've ever had, ever. The amount of dedicaton he has for his students is awe-inspiring. I hope that he knows how much he means to all of his students, because he is such an inspiration to us all.

Name: Michael Frame
Comment: The kindest professor ever.  I was really lost in multivariable, and he volunteered to explain the concepts to me every week for 2 hours.  I am so grateful to him.

Name: Michael Frame
Comment: I loved Prof. Frame!  I'm really not that much of a math person, but math 115 wasn't too hard for me.

Name: Michael Frame
Comment: He's basically my mentor at Yale. Outside of being funny he's extremely clear and intelligent - take one of the other classes he teaches, i.e. one of the fractal geometry ones.

Name: Michael Frame
Comment: Great! He explains concepts extremely well and is entertaining.

Name: Michael Frame
Comment: Professor Frame is the best professor I've had at Yale.  Math 120 is notorious for being a tough class, but Prof Frame teaches with amazing clarity.  He's also very helpful in office hours and review sessions.  If you have to take math120, only take his section!

Name: Michael Frame
Comment: Excellent prof. On the exam dates students from the other sections asked him questions and finally understood. Very nice guy, brings humor to the classroom. But not too helpful outside of class.

Name: Joseph Chang
Comment: Very nice in people and helpful as a teacher.

Name: Joseph Chang
Comment: Extremely clear. Almost too helpful. Good challenging courses.

Name: Joseph Chang
Comment: He's good!

Name: Joseph Chang
Comment: Joe Chang is the man.  He will take the time to explain everything to you.  He will not care if you turn things in late.  He will teach you statistics and you will love it.

Name: Joseph Chang
Comment: stats classes poorly structured.  he taught large lecture hall once a week, had no contact with students.  students from lecture were broken up into six classes ("sections") for the other day.  his notes were very clear, tho!

Name: Joseph Chang
Comment: No Comments

Name: Kyle Luh
Comment: Excellent teacher :)

Name: Kyle Luh
Comment: Excellent!

Name: Kyle Luh
Comment: He is absolutely amazing. I dont think I have ever had a funnier and smarter TA than him. I would consider retaking the class just based on the joy he brought to my days!!

Name: Kyle Luh
Comment: He was alright. He got distracted with too many stories. Sometimes he would say things like "we are done" when the problem was not complete and I still was not comfortable with the material.

Name: Kyle Luh
Comment: Best TA ever.  He is funny, clever, and very generous with his time.  He made learning discrete math my favorite activity that semester.  Also, he entertained us with many great stories, not necessarily related to math.

Name: Greg Friedman
Comment: i dont think he put effort into this class. he didn't explain things clearly and went at a really fast pace. i didn't learn anything

Name: Greg Friedman
Comment: A truly awful professor.  He teaches a math class devoid of interesting problems, strips it of its theory (though it's supposed to be a proof-based class), and simply tries to get through all of the material.

Name: Greg Friedman
Comment: Professor Friedman is great. He has a tendency to gear his lessons to the brightest kids in class, which is good but can create an intimidating atmosphere. His problem sets and tests are very hard, but he curves fairly. On the whole he is an engaging, excited, funny teacher who makes math exciting.

Name: Igor Frenkel
Comment: He never helps you and pretends to be too busy to meet with you. He makes you wait for half an hour before talking to you in office hours. He hates teaching and finds the material boring. He presents it in that way. It is really hard to understand the purpose of his lectures.

Name: Igor Frenkel
Comment: he was a nice guy and teaching was clear BUT he wasn't always around for his office hrs, doesn't put much effort into the class but it still turned out ok

Name: Igor Frenkel
Comment: This class was taught entirely by example.  Though a charming man, his teaching style was poor.  Explanations were needed and were sacrificed in favor of more sample problems.  In fact, the choice of textbook only provided example problems.  If you like example problems, take this class; otherwise, seek explanations elsewhere.

Name: Jay Emerson
Comment: Jay is very much an acquired taste. If you like or can get used to his style, you'll find that you can learn a lot from him and what you learn will benefit you for a long time. But if not, you may find him talkative, boastful (he is very clearly proud of everything he does), aloof and oblivious to his students' personal needs.

Name: Jay Emerson
Comment: has a very stern personality and offers very little praise, feel like he thinks the meaner is to students, the better he is of a teacher, but really not happy with him

Name: Jay Emerson
Comment: He's incredibly helpful. He will go out of his way to help any student who is willing to put the time in.

Name: Triet Le
Comment: Had him a long time ago, saw the one rating he had and thought it wasn't true, he was a great teacher

Name: Triet Le
Comment: Spends all class proving useless formulas on the board, not teaching material on the test or homework. ugh.

Name: Andrew Barron
Comment: Professor Barron gives straightforward lectures and tries not to leave anybody behind. He always makes time for students if you need extra help.

Name: Andrew Barron
Comment: He will put you to sleep. My DOG knows what a median is

Name: Jaejeong Lee
Comment: Very easy, but his class did not prepare me for higher mathematics at all, Math 225 or 222 with any other professor is better

Name: Jaejeong Lee
Comment: Jaejeong was a fantastic teacher.  When we would take exams students from other sections were very confused about areas that Jaejeong had made very clear.  He pushes you to study, but is always willing to help.  He is very good at organizing complex information and explaining it clearly.

Name: Gerry Brady
Tag: ['Amazing lectures', 'Test heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]
Comment: Honestly, Professor Brady is the best professor I've ever had in Computer Science. The level of detail that she is able to break down a problem is absolutely incredible . Trust me when I say this, but you won't get a professor with that kind of diligence in CS ever. She provides foundations and inputs unique insights on how to solve a problem.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Dry lectures,covers standard material, no inspiration, bad attitude & always grumpy.. just read her slides/notes from a classmate instead of attending.  It is quite easy to present math in a straightforward manner and still be clear like a textbook but she does nothing extra you can't read directly from a book

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Algorithms is one of the hardest classes I've ever taken, and it's no understatement to say that I don't know how I would've made it through without Gerry Brady. She really cares about her students, and puts an enormous amount of effort into her lectures -- and it shows.

Name: Gerry Brady
Tag: ['Get ready to read', 'Tough grader', 'Gives good feedback']
Comment: Gerry cares a lot about her students, but she is not a great teacher for this subject. She does not introduce topics with context, and distill the material into it's essential points. To put it another way lecture is like someone reading straight out of the textbook.  You're better off learning the material through videos online, much clearer.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Lots of people told me to just learn comp sci on my own - Gerry plays into that advice.  She does not add value as a professor.  Gerry's lectures are like reading out of a textbook.  She writes on the chalkboard for hours straight, missesrefuses to answer questions, and struggles to emphasize key points.  She doesn't distill jargon into wisdom.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Professor Brady is an incredible teacher. I had her this last quarter for algorithms, and am convinced she is the reason I enjoyed the subject so much. It was certainly difficult, but I felt that she made the material understandable. The only issue I took was her choice of TA - one of the TAs was excellent while the other was not as qualified.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Gerry is the best professor I have had in CSPP.  Her classes are challenging.  Homework are hard but that is how you learn. Tests are fair.  She uses the board a lot.  Make sure to take notes.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Very enthusiastic and helpful to her students. I loved the subject even more thanks to her style. I don't agree that her questions were too hard. She writes too much on the board though. I wish she uses PowerPoint more often.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Gerry is quite simply one of the very best professors I have ever had.  She will call on you of the blue and expect you to know the answer, which kept me very engaged in the class.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Algorithms is a difficult topic...I'm not sure I would have understood everything if it wasn't for Gerry.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Professor Brady's Algorithms course is difficult - as it should be.  It was an excellent experience and will push the average students to their best.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Gerry rocks.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: A gem of a teacher, Professor Brady is professional and personable. She has obvious command of this subject and is interested in her students. The material is difficult, but in some measure the difficulty will depend on your background. In any event, Gerry Brady is the prof to cover this with. Even with my limited skills, I did well in her course.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: Gerry is an amazing teacher - she explains difficult concepts in a patient and clear manner, is available to help students outside of class, and is inspirational in the breadth and depth of her knowledge of the topic.

Name: Gerry Brady
Comment: No Comments

Name: John Boller
Comment: No comment

Name: John Boller
Comment: A very committed instructor to teaching with a deep love for maths. Highly competent with a desire to inculcate in learners life skills in problem solving and critical thinking

Name: John Boller
Comment: The Bollerman is the best teacher I have ever had. It's a hard class, but he made it so much fun and interesting, and was incredibly personal with his students and really helpful.

Name: Paul Sally
Comment: Paul Sally is heavily involved in math education so he understands how to teach.  The fact that he is also a great mathematician means that you should jump at the chance to take any of his classes.

Name: Paul Sally
Comment: he was awesome!

Name: Paul Sally
Comment: Pretty easy. Deviates too much though!  We did a lot a lot of algebra (group theory, rings, etc).  Very random with the material.  Homework was very doable.  He's very very very helpful and friendly.  Put forth a strong effort and was forgiving to his students.

Name: Paul Sally
Comment: No Comments

Name: Paul Sally
Comment: Paul Sally is awesome.  With his prosthetic leg, eyepatch, and Boston brogue, he's quite a character.  He's brilliant and entertaining, if somewhat disorganized.  He inspires his students to work VERY hard.

Name: Madhav Nori
Comment: One of the best math teachers you'll ever meet. Austere, graceful and generous. Sorry that he doesn't involve the audience too much. Math is larger than you and I: he presents the material in its integral form and holds the bar at the respectful height.  The clarity makes it easy.  He means exactly what he says: think it over if it's non trivial.

Name: Madhav Nori
Comment: Pitched class at too high a level. Taught an intro undergrad class as if we were grad students. Little understanding of the abilities of students.

Name: Madhav Nori
Comment: great professor!! incredibaly talented and very helpful. It was an honor to be in his class.

Name: Madhav Nori
Comment: No Comments

Name: Madhav Nori
Comment: he's hard and fast but superb prof. mumbles a lot.  awesome instructor though.  doesn't understand the difficulties some ppl have with the material tho, but a nice guy though!!

Name: Sanjeevi Krishnan
Comment: Confusing sometimes, loves his subject (which is endearing), very kind.

Name: Sanjeevi Krishnan
Comment: No Comments

Name: Sanjeevi Krishnan
Comment: SEXY BUT TAKEN

Name: Sanjeevi Krishnan
Comment: Laid back and pretty easy

Name: Chris Bremer
Comment: Worst professor I've had at UChicago.  His lectures were unclear and useless.  The homework was hard and long and he wasn't willing to help very much.

Name: Chris Bremer
Comment: knows his material better than he can actually teach it, helps if you ask a question during the exam

Name: Chris Bremer
Comment: Super cute!

Name: Chris Bremer
Comment: cute!

Name: Iyer Gautam
Comment: He has a great love for math and his students which exudes in the classroom.  He's very fair.  He made a point to stay in touch with me after the class as well!  He's a fun guy who makes math fun!

Name: Iyer Gautam
Comment: He really loves math...and somehow makes it bearable for the class!  He also really cares about his students!

Name: Iyer Gautam
Comment: Gautam is fantastic.  He is a brilliant teacher who makes the class challenging yet amazing.  Together with Fefferman, I couldn't have asked for a better class as a freshman

Name: Iyer Gautam
Comment: Best calc professor i've ever had

Name: Raghavan Narasimhan
Comment: genius

Name: Raghavan Narasimhan
Comment: Incredibly hard!  Develops theory very quickly.  Goes *VERY* fast.  Knows the material very well, a bit too well at times.  Accessible and friendly in office hours.  This man is a genius.  He mumbles a lot though.  Don't go in unless you're prepared.  It's an insane experience with this guy.

Name: Raghavan Narasimhan
Comment: Mumbles into the board, totally unintelligible lectures.  Crazy smart.  Writes proofs on the board from memory faster than one can copy them down.  And amazingly deep South Indian Accent

Name: Raghavan Narasimhan
Comment: hard as h*ll but you'll learn alot if you can keep up...goes thru a LOT of math in 1 qtr.  take him if you can handle the work..expect 30+ hrs of work a week...best academic experience you'll ever have, if you can handle it!!

Name: Maxim Leyenson
Comment: fantastic, clear and helpful

Comment: Extremelly shady grading policies, if you can call them policies.  MATH IS NOT SUBJECTIVE.

Name: Evangelos Kobotis
Comment: Got a B,B,A on the final accordingly(all curved). Studied my butt off, I'm talking 10+ hours per week. He expects this. I love math, but this class was the end of me. Ace the final and you get an A on the class. I left with my hands shaky, dizziness after exams. DONT SLACK ON HW, have TA'sMTH TUT help. YT vids from InfiniteLooper saved my life.

Name: Evangelos Kobotis
Comment: If you understood 180 well, then go ahead and take Kobotis. He gives a lot of homework, but after all, practice makes perfect.He's almost too smart though. He often skips showing some details in work and does problems quickly and elaborates on things that aren't as important in terms of the general UIC math curriculum for calculus.

Name: Evangelos Kobotis
Comment: yaa he sucks at teaching

Name: Evangelos Kobotis
Comment: An excellent and gifted teacher.  He was lucid, approachable, and always engaging!

Name: Laszlo Babai
Comment: Professor Babai is one of the best professors at the University of Chicago. He is both a brilliant mathematician in his own right as well as an incredible teacher, lecturer, mentor (a combination that can be very hard to come by). He leads you to solutions so that you truly understand, he is encouraging, and he gives problems that lead to insight.

Name: Laszlo Babai
Comment: He's not ridiculously difficult and he doesn't assign a ridiculous amount of work (compared to some of the other math classes), but he does expect you to put in consistent (and relatively high) amount of solid work. His clarity, enthusiasm and demanding nature makes him the best professor I've had in this school.

Name: Laszlo Babai
Comment: I had Babai for Algorithms and Combinatorics around 2000-1.  Damn straight he was hard. The commenter before me is mistaken. He doesn't expect you to know everything already; he just expects you to work your ass off. One of the best professors I ever had.

Name: Laszlo Babai
Comment: Spends more time showing people how little they know than in teaching. Expects students to come into the course knowing all the material.

Name: Eva Strawbridge
Comment: Fall 2012 semster was Eva's first semester at James Madison University, and my first math professor in college. She is by far the best math teacher I've had. I put a lot of time and effort to excel in this class & she has been very helpful and supportive. I really like her class, and i would give her the credit for my new math minor. She's awesome.

Name: Eva Strawbridge
Comment: Very clear, dynamic lecturer who both holds your attention and covers a lot of ground. Her OHs are incredibly helpful. The exams are daunting because she doesn't curve, but always end up being fair. Strawbridge's class made me want to pursue a BA in math--she really makes it interesting, and her enthusiasm for her subfield, too, is contagious.

Name: Eva Strawbridge
Comment: Eva Strawbridge is the best math professor I've had at the University of Chicago, by a mile. She is fun, and she is fair in her exams. I struggled so hard in math my first year in college, and now thanks to her I'm pursuing a math major!! If you take math 199, take it with no one else but her. You won't regret it. Thank you Eva! <3 you forever!

Name: Eva Strawbridge
Comment: Her classes are very organized. She is also very fair in her exams. Bonus: she is very attractive.

Name: Ben O'Connor
Comment: Incredible teacher. Excited about mathematics but in a really cool way. He genuinely tries to help you and is ALWAYS available. Great teacher, great personality.

Name: Ben O'Connor
Comment: Great teacher plus super cute

Name: Ben O'Connor
Comment: Awesome class, best math grad student at UChicago.

Name: Ben O'Connor
Comment: Best instructor ever. He got me really interested in math, and he explained concepts in a way that it seems so easy. (and He's hot)

Name: Sidney Webster
Comment: So. Boring.

Name: Sidney Webster
